issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

versions.description: Dynamic Reconfig, Remove Watches, Local Session

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
Zookeeper v3.5.0-alpha experiences an error when trying to create a simple data node.

Versions before and after 3.5.0-alpha work just fine, but this specific version oddly fails to create data nodes.

Source:

https://github.com/mcandre/docker-zookeeper/tree/3.5.0-alpha

Trace:

```
$ git clone git@github.com:mcandre/docker-zookeeper.git
$ cd docker-zookeeper.git
$ git checkout 3.5.0-alpha
$ make
CONTAINER=$(docker run -d -p 2181:2181 -p 2888:2888 -p 3888:3888 mcandre/docker-zookeeper:3.5.0-alpha)
docker exec $CONTAINER sh -c 'echo "create /dog moon" | zkCli.sh'
Connecting to localhost:2181

[zk: localhost:2181(CONNECTING) 0] create /dog moon

make: *** [run] Error 1
```

comments.body: Hi [~mcandre], If it is fixed in 3.5.1-alpha, then you should just use that version. Does it make sense?

Thanks, I might try that. Though I'd prefer to use a stable release
version, if that makes sense.

On Friday, November 20, 2015, Flavio Junqueira (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>



-- 
Cheers,
Andrew
It does make sense to prefer a stable release, so perhaps you should be using releases from the 3.4 branch instead, unless you really need the features in 3.5.

Are any 3.x release versions fixed for this issue? The latest download
appears to be 3.4.6, which is still affected.

On Friday, November 20, 2015, Flavio Junqueira (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>



-- 
Cheers,
Andrew
Is this still and issue? If not we should close it.
